result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio J Deal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio J Deal in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in for purposes of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties. 
As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 5 months in the House of Correction with credit of 10 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work.  Court stays report date to 12-07-2015 by 9:00 am. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, by 12-01-2016.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of sentence and full payment of costs and surcharges. 

filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Sentencing Referral Formf

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, Defendant Antonio J Deal not in court, in custody (bull pen).  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense unable to go over plea forms with the Defendant today requesting an adjournment. Defendant was produced from Racine County for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Antonio J Deal not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Defendant NOT produced, in Racine County. Case adjourned for a Plea Hearing in branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Antonio J Deal not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial.  Neither party requests to address the court on the record.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Antonio J Deal not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Entry made without court file.  Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Leija contacted court to set case for a scheduling conference.  Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference on 6-15-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 45.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed:  missed telephone contact on 06-02-2015 and new arrest on 06-04-2015.
Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date.

Defendant Antonio J Deal in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel requested case be set for Motion Hearing. Court ordered defense to file any motions by 6-11-2015.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Antonio J Deal in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Antonio J Deal in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
